intro: Memecylon lijndenia, commonly known as the African shield vine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite, elliptic leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, round, red berries. Memecylon lijndenia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. Its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions make it a popular choice for horticultural use in suitable climates.
